messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1494
messages.msgSnippet: He is an EMT with our local fire department.  It is only volunteer but it is all we ve got.  :) Feeling much better now.
messages.messageBody:
<<what are emergency services?>>

He is an EMT with our local fire department. It is only volunteer but it is
all we've got. :)

Feeling much better now. Taught my karate class. Hit and yelled stuff.
Aaaahhhh. much better.

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1494
messages.msgSnippet: Kathryn, My little Marsie adores fairies.  I would very much be interested in buying some from you.  Could you tell me a little about what you make? Julie
messages.messageBody:
Kathryn,

My little Marsie adores fairies. I would very much be interested in buying
some from you. Could you tell me a little about what you make?

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1494
messages.msgSnippet: I have a 4yo who never follows instruction , completely does her own thing at all times.  In dance class, she spent much of the hour sitting
messages.messageBody:
<<music class>>

I have a 4yo who never follows "instruction", completely does her own thing
at all times. In dance class, she spent much of the hour sitting on her
bottom spinning in circles (dance floors spin ever so nicely LOL). I talked
to the teacher to be sure she wasn't angry. Teacher said goes with the
territory, no big deal. Most people who work with kids, especially young
children, understand that kids do what kids do. I wouldn't worry about it
unless the teacher gets angry or your ds doesn't want to go anymore.

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1494
messages.msgSnippet: {{{{{{{Julie}}}}}}} Hang in there, girl!  We re all suffering through this....aday....a moment at a time.  Keep things simple  and keep on doing those things
messages.messageBody:
{{{{{{{Julie}}}}}}}
Hang in there, girl! We're all suffering through this....aday....a moment
at a time. Keep things simple and keep on doing those things that bring
health and comfort to you and yours.
Suz
> I am so tired of being on edge. It seems the tension in our home has
> mounted continually since the 11th. Dh is in the emergency services and
> gets memos from the FBI saying look out for this, look out for that, our
> intelligence suggests this......
>
> The kids have descended into bickering in front of a television they
aren't
> even watching. I am squawking at everybody. The little kids are
basically
> out of control and I am having trouble getting a handle back on things
>
> On top of this, my little guy has to go into the hospital for tests and my
> oldest injured her wrist badly and is basically one-handed for awhile.
>
> I feel better for venting. Maybe we will make some cookies, a cup of kava
> kava for me, some milk for the kiddies. Maybe read a book or cuddle and
> watch a movie. I already feel better and calmer. Funny how just typing
out
> things does that.
>
> Julie
>
>
>

> ________________________________________________________________________

> >
> > I can assure you that for Helen dealing with her father's stroke and my
> own
> > husband on Reserve standby and my own father bedridden, neither of the
two
> > listed moderators have the time or energy for such an undertaking. I've
> been
> > updating our will and getting my dh to create a general power of
attorney.
> > Frankly, I'm appalled at how uncharacteristically juvenile this list has

> >
> > Helen and I are listed as *moderators* at yahoogroups. We help folks sub

> > unsub. We maintain the admin duties at yahoo. If you take the time to
> visit
> > that webpage you will see that in the description of this list it states
> we
> > are an unmoderated list. I simply couldn't get yahoo to list that aspect
> as
> > different from what it really is. Yahoo doesn't work that way.
> >
> > If you are having mail that isn't going through, then your right there
